action.action-desc: Mr. Collins (for himself, Mr. Panetta, Mr. Kelly of Pennsylvania, and Mrs. McBath) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow qualified distributions from qualified tuition programs for certain aviation maintenance and commercial pilot courses.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Aviation Workforce Development Act.

section.header: Qualified distributions from qualified tuition programs for certain aviation maintenance and commercial pilot courses

subsection.text: Section 529(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Treatment of certain aviation maintenance and commercial pilot courses

subparagraph.text: Any reference in this subsection to the term qualified higher education expense shall include a reference to expenses for tuition, fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for the participation of a designated beneficiary in a qualified aviation maintenance course or a qualified commercial pilot course.

For purposes of this paragraph, the term qualified aviation maintenance course means any course of instruction taught at an aviation maintenance technician school governed by part 147 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.

The term qualified commercial pilot course means a commercial pilot course taught at a flight school that provides flight training, as defined in part 61 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations, or that holds a pilot school certificate under part 141 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to distributions made after the date of the enactment of this Act.
